admin_templates.template:
<script>
<!--
$(document).ready(function()
{
	var auto = $('#ctrl_optionsgfnlinkproxy_autoRedirectDelay').closest('fieldset'),
	noAuto = $('#ctrl_optionsgfnlinkproxy_title').closest('fieldset'),
	toggler = $('#ctrl_optionsgfnlinkproxy_enableAutoRedirect_1'),
	toggleOptions = function()
	{
		if (toggler.is(':checked'))
		{
			auto.xfSlideIn('medium');
			noAuto.xfSlideOut('medium');
		}
		else
		{
			noAuto.xfSlideIn('medium');
			auto.xfSlideOut('medium');
		}
	};
	
	toggler.click(toggleOptions);
	toggleOptions();
});
//-->
</script>

option.default_value: You are now leaving {board} and being redirected to {url} in {delay} seconds...

The referring site you are being redirected to is not controlled by us, so please remember not to enter your Username and Password unless you are on {boardUrl}. Also be sure to download software from sites you trust. And remember to read the site's Privacy Policy.

phrases.phrase:
The time of delay (in seconds) before the user is redirected.
Enter 0 to redirect the user to out-going link without showing the intermediary page. This also means that the referrer wont (partially) anonymized.

You can change the text that appears as the message or disclaimer on the redirection page.
You may use the following variables: {board}, {boardUrl}, {url}, {delay}.
You can change the text that appears as the title on the redirection page.
If enabled, the referrer HTTP header will be checked (if available) if the URL is referred from the same origin. If not, a 'no permission' message will be dispatched.
You can disable automatic redirection if you want your visitor to click "Continue" on the redirection page to visit the page, instead of automatically being redirected.
